    Yalun Wu

    Ph.D. Student at Beijing Jiaotong University

    • Beijing, China
    • Email
    • Github
    • Google Scholar

    Hi! I am Yalun Wu (吴亚伦 in Chinese). I am a Ph.D. student in the School of Computer and Information Techonoly at Beijing Jiaotong University, and affiliated with the Beijing Key Laboratory of Security and Privacy in Intelligent Transportation. I am advised by Prof. Zhen Han, Wenjia Niu and Assistant Prof. Endong Tong. Prior to my Ph.D. career, I received the B.S. degree in communication engineering from Qingdao Agricultural University in 2017, and the M.S. degree in software engineering from Beijing Jiaotong University in 2022.

    Currently, my research has centered on:

    • AI Security: backdoor attacks and defenses, adversarial attacks and defenses.

    • Safety Testing: testing and evaluation for autonomous driving algorithms, modules, and systems.

    • Data Augmentation: image or video generation, especially focus on generative data augmentation (GDA) in autonomous driving scenarios.

    • Autonomous Driving Security: attacks and defenses against the physical world, sensors, algorithms and automonous driving systems.

    • Reinforcement Learning: safety reinforcement learning (SRL), robustness reinforcement learning and offline reinforcement learning for autonomous driving systems.

    📮: I am always looking for related colaboration. If you are interested to chat with me, feel free to drop me an email.
